page.title: 16Houses - Boars Hill area
page.content: The houses on Boars Hill itself are mostly large detatched properties surrounded by large gardens and woods. Most of these houses have been built within the past 90 years and are constructed mainly of brick with tiled roofs. In the 19th century there was a small brick and tile works opposite the Fox Inn but there is no trace of it left today. The Houses in Bayworth are much smaller and consist of detatched, semi- -detatched and terraced houses, many of them owned by the Vale of the White Horse District Council, a typical rent in 1985 is 20 pounds per week. During the review a house was sold on Boars Hill for 135,000 pounds and one in Bayworth for 60,000 pounds.
